domosaics.ui.views.view
Interface View

All Known Subinterfaces:
DomainViewI
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractView, DomainView
public interface View

The View interface defining all methods which can be applied to each view.

A view object for rendering, layouting and manipulating a backend data set such as domain arrangements needs to store various information about itself. To mention only a couple of them: its unique id (created by AngstdViewFactory during its creations), various icons for display within the workspace, its type and so on. All those information are stored in form of a ViewInfo object and can be accessed using getViewInformation().

Each possible view can be created using the AngstdViewFactory (but look first into ViewHandler where methods are defined for this purpose. When creating a new view someone just have to know its ViewType the rest is done automatically.

When a view is automatically created its properties file is used, which MUST be located in a resource folder which is the same level within the package structure as the special view class itself (The path to this view class is stored in the ViewType and used to find the properties file).

For more details on the view see its basic implementation AbstractView.

Author:
Andreas Held

Method Detail

setViewInfo

void setViewInfo(ViewInfo info)
Set the ViewInfo which contains all backend data for the view (e.g. its unique id, icons ...).

Parameters:
info - the view information to store

getViewInfo

ViewInfo getViewInfo()
Returns the views information such as unique id various icons and so on all coupled within the ViewInfo object.

Returns:
wieInfo object holding all relevant information about the view.

getComponent

javax.swing.JComponent getComponent()
Returns the component containing the view. This can be the view itself or a surrounding component, e.g. ScrollPane

Returns:
the component embedding the view (or the view itself)

getViewComponent

javax.swing.JComponent getViewComponent()
Returns the real view component. This is used to split the view component from a component that is returned by getComponent().

For example, getComponent() might return a ScrollPane that contains the JComponent returned by this method.

Returns:
the real view

getParentPane

ViewPanel getParentPane()
Returns the panel displaying this view

Returns:
the view panel

setParentPane

void setParentPane(ViewPanel parent)
Sets this views parent pane.

Parameters:
parent - the viewPanel containing the view

render

void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
Render the view on the given graphics object. The graphics object might be a Graphics object created by an exporter, so the view can be exported in different formats by using this method.

Parameters:
g - the graphics object on which is used for rendering the view

Returns whether or not the view is in zoom mode.

Returns:
whether or not the view is within zoom mode

toggleZoomMode

void toggleZoomMode()
Switches the zoom mode for a view between on and off.
